bioghist.p: Hector Bolitho (1897-1974) was a New Zealand native and the author of more than fifty books, largely nonfiction. He is most noted for his biographies of the British royal family: Albert the Good and the Victorian Reign (1932); Albert, Prince Consort (1964); and The Reign of Queen Victoria (1948). One of his few novels, Judith Silver, also received critical acclaim in 1929. In addition to authoring books, Bolitho was a frequent contributor to magazines in England, the United States, Germany, Pakistan, and several other countries, and he lecture extensively in the United States.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Hector Bolitho. Materials in the collection include: correspondence between Bolitho and Aga Khan regarding a biography of Jinnah and an autobiography by Kahn; research materials related to Bolitho's book, Jinnah, Creator of Pakistan: correspondence with Lord Mountbatten of Burma, General Lord Ismay, and Colonel Majeed Malik; obituaries; typed copies of letters by Jinnah; and notes from interviews. Other items in the collection include bound volumes of research notes on Jinnah, Pakistan, and Aga Khan. These volumes include newspaper clippings, typed extracts, and articles.
